channel.title: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)
channel.description: This has happened to me a few times idk about you. Tell me about it.

item.title: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)
item.dc:creator: Devoid-of-joy
item.description:
I’ve got about 50 project that are unfinishable, but when everything ya do is an experiment some specimens will be lost through testing phases.
I’ve never had a permanent deletion happen yet though.

item.title: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)
item.dc:creator: stereofield
item.description:
When I was first making Fade, I deleted the main drum rack by accident. Meant to delete one of the loops. I had to remake it, but it turned out better than the first time, so I’m not complaining

item.source: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)

item.title: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)
item.dc:creator: BobTheGUYYYYY
item.description:
Only when I got an entirely new iPhone. All of my projects got deleted so I had to start all projects entirely from scratch.

Yeah, I was pretty bummed about that. But I’m a lot better than I was now, so it’s okay I guess

Looking back on it those projects were actually pretty bad

Read full topic
item.source: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)

item.title: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)
item.dc:creator: Plhector
item.description:
I’ve accidentally deleted 3 songs while trying to delete finished/unused projects. I never recreated 2 of them because I couldn’t remember how I created automations and couldn’t exactly remember what instruments where in the track.
One of the lost tracks that I still had a render of:
07:00

The 3rd track was successfully recreated so I’m pretty happy about that. It’s one of my favorite tracks I’ve worked on so far.

Read full topic
item.source: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)

item.title: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
One time an entire project disappeared overnight. That was fun, it was replaced by an older version. This was back in the 4 day’s though so no biggie xD but I suppose I ruined many of my songs beyond repair at times. Most of these songs don’t make it in the end though … although there was that one time I screwed up the drums so hard while making SFH with @Peregrihn that we had to start over practically with the drums xD

Read full topic
item.source: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)

item.title: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)
item.dc:creator: brandnaqua
item.description:
i’m too indecisive to have an undo button, that would enable me to move back and think of the past too much rather than think forward BUT it would be good for those with well disciplined self control

Read full topic

item.title: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)
item.dc:creator: brandnaqua
item.description:
ayyy hopefully not a lot of progress! has happened to me too though usually when coming up with major drum patterns so when stuff gets really good sometimes I’ll get out the app and re-enter so it could hopefully auto save up to that good point

item.source: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)

item.title: Have you ever ruined a project beyond repair? (Accidentally deleted loops, instrument changes, etc)
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
Nothing “beyond repair” as in I wouldn’t theoretically be able to restore it, but I have goofed up a few times due to accidental touches / swipes in the app resulting in some headaches, including but not limited to:

  • Deleting note(s) / automation nodes while trying to scroll
  • Accidentally moving loops to other instruments resulting in them being deselected everywhere in the track
  • Deselecting note / automation loops and not noticing until rendering or, in rare cases, after the song is released
  • Pre Auxy 5, switching scene order while trying to scroll through the timeline
spoiler

Read full topic
